parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Hello, you must be Lord Ormond. \|\|\^
Yes, I am. What are you after? \|\|\^
I wanted to speak to you about Prince Lansee. \|\|\^
Oh, so you are the boy he sent for? \|\|\^
I’m who he sent for. He needs help with this war. \|\|\^
He needs more than help. He has lost this war. I hope you didn’t come - \|\|\^
- here to try and convince me to support him. \|\|\^
That is what I came to do. He is the heir to the throne, you are supposed - \|\|\^
Yes, I know what my duty is. But I won’t let my house fall to help his claim. - \|\|\^
- Especially when the odds aren’t in his favour. If I support his claim - \|\|\^
- and his brothers succeed in taking the throne they will slaughter the houses - \|\|\^
So does Prince Lansee have your support? \|\|\^
I’m afraid that’s a no. If there’s overwhelming support for him, maybe - \|\|\^
You obtained Lord Ormond's Entry in the Journal.

Ah Lord Cedric of Haffenden. I see you have returned to my home. What is it - \|\|\^
I wanted to let you know that we’re here to help. \|\|\^
With removing Roswell from power in Rinsar. \|\|\^
I don’t recall me saying I’d like him gone. \|\|\^
But he seized control? And has caused many atrocities across the region. - \|\|\^
- How can you be okay with that? \|\|\^
He has kept Rinsar safe. Moreover, the safety of my house is ensured with him. - \|\|\^
- I told you before that I wouldn’t put my house at risk. \|\|\^
So you’re going to abandon all sense of duty then? \|\|\^
If it means my family is safe, yes. \|\|\^
Lord Ormond's entry in the Journal was updated.

Lord Cedric and King Dormato. What can I do for you? \|\|\^
The last time I was here to get your help to take down Roswell you refused me. - \|\|\^
- You said you wouldn’t put your house at risk but now I have removed Roswell. - \|\|\^
My house will follow the Haffenden, Lord Cedric. \|\|\^
You were sworn to follow Prince Lansee, the heir apparent of Rinsar and when - \|\|\^
- approached you turned your back leaving him to die while you rose in prominence - \|\|\^
- and wealth. Both times you were provided with the opportunity to do what’s - \|\|\^
- right and both times you failed. Even after Roswell’s death you were idle while - \|\|\^
- his armies continued to trouble the majority of the kingdoms in the realm. \|\|\^
The time for explaining is over. Guards seize him! It seems your efforts to - \|\|\^
- keep your family from risk has led them to it. \|\|\^
Please my Lord! Don’t do this! I will change! \|\|\^
